Feminized Cannabis Seeds

High-performance genetics for growers who take their craft seriously. This curated line of feminized photoperiod strains delivers ...
Read more
High-performance genetics for growers who take their craft seriously. This curated line of feminized photoperiod strains delivers stable, high-yielding plants with intense terpene profiles and rich, layered flavors. Designed for professionals, commercial cultivators, and dedicated pheno hunters, each seed guarantees female plants and top-tier performance. Whether youre running a large-scale setup or chasing rare expressions, this collection is built to meet the highest standards and exceed expectations.

We've dedicated over 15 years to breeding the best cannabis genetics, which allowed us to gather plenty of photoperiod (non-autoflowering) samples. Throughout these many years, we have created an exceptional collection of feminized strains (those that produce only female plants). Through relentless experimentation, crossing, and backcrossing, we selected our best keepers and started to pheno hunt for the most exclusive Californian genetics. We always followed our path in the same direction, but thousands of growers from our community have asked us to release some photoperiod strains. We made our mind up that if we were going to do that, we needed to come up with something special, something that could make a difference in the product standard. So we dedicated ourselves to finding the best terpene profiles and combining them with high THC strains with great yield possibilities. As a result, we're presenting a super limited drop available on our website only, with some of the best terpene profiles, a guaranteed 100% germination rate and all the Fast Buds quality standards: now in our Feminized Photoperiod Seeds.

What Exactly are Feminized Cannabis Seeds?

Feminized seeds are carefully bred to grow only into female plants which are the ones that produce those beautiful THC-rich buds that we all know, no need to deal with male plants.

Feminized seeds also offer a distinct advantage for cultivators who want to preserve a specific cultivar. By opting for feminized cannabis, growers can ensure a consistent and nearly all-female crop by taking clones or maintaining mother plants. This practice allows cultivators to reproduce the same specific phenotype repeatedly, ensuring the unique qualities and characteristics that they may value in that particular strain. 

We take pride in producing seeds that are carefully selected and meticulously tested to provide excellent germination rates and vigorous growth.

What are the Benefits of Feminized Cannabis Seeds?

Feminized seeds offer several advantages over regular cannabis seeds as, mainly and most importantly, they grow into female plants, eliminating the need to get rid of male plants. This ensures that every plant in your weed garden will produce buds, maximizing yields while minimizing time, money, and effort spent.

Opting for feminized seeds allows you to streamline your cultivation process, allowing you to consistently get high yields and top-shelf harvests, improving your seed-to-harvest cycle by making it more convenient and efficient.

How to Correctly Choose Feminized Cannabis Seeds?

Choosing the right feminized seeds is crucial for a successful cultivation cycle as the strain will dictate the size of the plant, the effects, the flavors, and the potency you'll experience. 

Before buying feminized seeds, make sure to understand the difference between Indica, Sativa, Hybrids, THC, and CBD. Generally speaking, Indicas offer more relaxing effects and grow shorter, Sativas offer energizing effects and grow taller, while Hybrids offer a mix of both. 

Remember that different cannabis strains produce different scents and flavors, so make sure to pick the one that aligns with your preferences. Also, take into account the grow space (indoors, outdoors, greenhouses) as different strains thrive in different conditions and each grow space presents its own limitations.

Considering the difficulty of growth for each strain, some cannabis seeds require more attention or can be more finicky, or require more maintenance than others.

Once you know exactly what feminized seeds you want, make sure to choose a reputable seed bank such as Fast Buds. By using top-quality seeds you guarantee higher germination rates, healthier plants, and an overall better harvest in terms of quality and quantity.

What Are The Main Differences Between Indica and Sativa Feminized Strains?

Indica and Sativa are two different types of cannabis, each with unique characteristics and effects. 

Indica strains, native to colder climates, are known for their compact, bushy appearance, and broader leaves. They typically mature faster than Sativas and produce dense, resinous buds. Indicas are often known for their physically relaxing effects, making them suitable for evening use or aiding with sleep and pain relief.

On the other hand, Sativa strains, originating from warmer regions, are tall and slender, with narrow leaves. They require more time to mature, but often yield larger harvests. Sativas are typically known for their stimulating, cerebral effects, enhancing creativity and sociability, making them a popular choice for daytime use.

Feminized Indica or Sativa strains provide the grower with the confidence that nearly all plants will be bud-producing females, maximizing the yield from each crop. This makes feminized seeds particularly popular among growers, regardless of their preference for Indica or Sativa effects.

How to Effectively Grow Feminized Cannabis Seeds?

Growing feminized seeds requires a certain level of experience but can be very easy as long as you keep in mind the following tips.

The main and most important factor to take into consideration is the growing conditions. In a suitable growing environment, always aim for proper temperature, humidity, and lighting conditions to provide a good environment for your plants, whether its indoors or outdoors.

Start by germinating your feminized seeds using proven techniques such as soaking the seeds in a glass of water for 48hs, then transferring the seeds to a paper towel until a thick, white root comes out.

Once the seed germinates, transplant it to a bigger pot and pay close attention. In the next couple of weeks, the plant will need proper nutrition, specifically designed for cannabis. 

During the flowering stage, continue to monitor the plant for signs of pests, diseases, or deficiencies. Whenever possible, implement preventive measures such as regular inspection, proper airflow, and pest control methods.

And as harvest time comes, closely observe trichome development to determine the optimal harvest time. By reading and paying attention to all these details and practices, you will enjoy a smooth and successful feminized seeds grow cycle.

How to Successfully Grow Feminized Cannabis Seeds Indoors?

Growing feminized cannabis seeds indoors offers the advantage of all plants turning into bud-producing females. Begin by carefully germinating the seeds in a moist, warm environment, then transplant them to pots filled with nutrient-rich, well-draining soil.

Invest in quality grow lights that cover the full light spectrum. Tailor the light schedule to the plant's growth stage - 18/6 hours of light/dark during vegetative growth, then 12/12 hours during flowering. To maximize yield, consider techniques like Low Stress Training (LST) or Screen of Green (ScrOG).

Maintain a stable environment, keeping temperature around 70-85F (23-29C) during the lights ON period and not below 58-70F (15-21C) during the dark period. Humidity should start at around 70% for seedlings, gradually reducing to around 40-50% during vegetative growth, and further down to 30-40% in flowering.

Regularly water the plants, but be careful not to overwater. Cannabis prefers a cycle from wet to dry. Feed them with a balanced nutrient solution, altering the mix as they transition from vegetative growth to flowering.

Monitor for pests and diseases. Feminized seeds will generally flower after a few weeks of growth, depending on the strain. Harvest when trichomes are mostly cloudy with some amber.

How to Successfully Grow Feminized Cannabis Seeds Outdoors?

Growing feminized cannabis seeds outdoors involves careful planning and consideration of the local climate. Feminized seeds ensure that nearly all plants will be females.

Start by germinating seeds indoors or in a greenhouse in early spring, then move them outdoors after the last frost. Choose a sunny spot, ensuring plants getas much sunlight as possible each day. Use well-draining, nutrient-rich soil with a pH between 6.0 and 7.0.

Watering should be regular but avoid overwatering as cannabis prefers a cycle from wet to dry. Feed the plants with a balanced nutrient mix, shifting from nitrogen-rich to phosphorus and potassium-rich as they transition to flowering.

Keep an eye out for pests and diseases, implementing organic or chemical controls as necessary. Provide support structures if necessary, as some feminized strains can grow quite large and heavy.

As the days start to shorten, your plants will begin to flower. The flowering time will depend on the strain. Harvest when most of the trichomes on the buds shift from clear to a milky white or amber color. After harvesting, dry and cure the buds properly to ensure quality and freshness.

How to Correctly Water Feminized Cannabis Seeds?

Correct watering is crucial for the successful cultivation of feminized cannabis seeds. Start by soaking the seeds in lukewarm water for 24-48 hours to initiate germination. Once they've sprouted, carefully transfer them into a moist, well-draining growing medium.

During the early stages, it's important to keep the growing medium damp but not waterlogged. Overwatering can lead to oxygen starvation and root rot. Water lightly around the seedling, not directly onto it.

As the plants grow, their water needs increase. Wait until thee soil is fairly dry before watering again. This cycle from wet to dry is preferred by cannabis and helps prevent overwatering.

Temperature and humidity play a significant role in water absorption, so monitor these conditions closely. If the environment is too hot or too dry, it may cause the plant to require more frequent watering.

Remember, under-watering is better than overwatering. Signs of under-watering, such as drooping leaves, are easily correctable, while overwatering can lead to severe issues like root diseases. Always water slowly, ensuring the water is well distributed in the soil and a little runoff occurs to prevent nutrient buildup.

What is The Most Suitable Soil for Feminized Cannabis Seeds?

The most suitable soil for feminized cannabis seeds is a well-draining, rich soil, typically a loamy or sandy-loam type. Good soil structure allows the roots to breathe and grow, ensuring healthy plant development.

Nutrient content is crucial. The soil should contain a mix of organic matter that provides key macronutrients (Nitrogen, Phosphorus, Potassium) and micronutrients (Calcium, Iron, Magnesium, etc.). Some growers prefer cannabis-specific soil mixes that come pre-loaded with these nutrients.

The soil's pH is another important factor, as it impacts the plant's ability to absorb nutrients. The optimal pH range for cannabis is between 6.0 and 7.0.

Feminized cannabis seeds also benefit from soil with beneficial microbes, such as mycorrhizal fungi, which enhance nutrient uptake, improve root health, and increase resistance to disease.

Water retention is essential but must be balanced with good drainage to prevent waterlogging and associated root problems. A soil rich in organic matter can effectively hold moisture while also providing adequate drainage.

Remember, healthy soil contributes to a healthy plant, ultimately leading to a better yield from your feminized cannabis seeds.
